DHACAâ€™s objectives are to help catalyse the market in digital health and care by supporting its members to address key obstacles and points of market failure on a consensus-based approach.

DHACA represents nearly 950 members across health & social care: commissioners, providers, sector bodies, regulators and patient groups, together with tech firms ranging from micro SMEs and start-ups to major global brands.
interests: Consumer Affairs, Information Society, Public Health, Research and Technology
euInitiatives:
DHACA is a member of the C2 Action Group in the European Innovation Partnership on Active & Healthy Ageing initiative (EIP-AHA). We have attended the Conference of Partners in the past three years.

DHACA also responded extensively to the EC's Green Paper on mHealth, our response involving contributions from over 50 DHACA members. As a result we were invited to become a member of the drafting team for the Code of Conduct on privacy for mobile health applications, where again we continue to play an active role.

More generally DHACA's members have a strong interest in the development of both the EU's Medical Devices and Data Protection Regulations.
